author: Afshan Yasmeen
text:
In his death, Basavaraj (37) from Tumkuru has given a new lease of life to six others.

After he met with an accident near Tumakuru while he was on his two-wheeler on March Monday, Basavaraj was initially admitted to Sapthagiri Hospital with a severe brain injury.

However, despite all kinds of treatment he did not recover.

After discussing matters with the doctors at the hospital, the family members agreed to donate his organs.

Assistance

Accordingly, with assistance from the Zonal Coordination Committee of Karnataka for Transplantation (ZCCK), Basavaraj was shifted from Sapthagiri Hospital and moved to the neuro-critical care at BGS Global Hospitals on Thursday.

He was re-evaluated and declared brain dead, as per the protocol.

The organ retrieval happened subsequently. Basvaraj’s heart, liver, kidneys and eyes were donated.

While the heart and kidney were transplanted to two patients at M.S. Ramaiah Hospital, the eyes were donated to Narayana Nethralaya.

The liver was transplanted to a 43-year-old man at B.G.S. Global Hospitals while the other kidney was given to a patient at Narayana Hrudalaya.

The heart and one kidney were transplanted to two patients at M.S. Ramaiah Hospital
title: Brain-dead man gives many a fresh shot at life
